Staff.admin module

Django Admin Registration

This module provides registration of models in the Django admin site.

class Staff.admin.StaffAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]

Bases: ModelAdmin

Customizes the display of the Staff model in the Django admin site.

Inherits from admin.ModelAdmin to provide customization options for the Staff model.

hall

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Staff.tests module

Django Model Tests Documentation

This module contains tests for the Staff and Visitor models. These tests ensure the integrity and functionality of the models under various scenarios.

class Staff.tests.StaffModelTests(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: TestCase

Tests for the Staff model.

test_blank_optional_fields()[source]

Test that optional fields can be blank or null.

This test verifies that optional fields in the Staff model, such as ‘name’ and ‘username’, can be left blank or set to None.

test_create_staff()[source]

Test creating a Staff instance with valid data.

This test verifies that a Staff instance can be created with valid data, including the necessary related instances such as Hall, HallAdmin, and Provost.

test_unique_email()[source]

Test the uniqueness of the email field.

This test ensures that the email field in the Staff model is unique.

class Staff.tests.VisitorModelTests(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: TestCase

Tests for the Visitor model.

test_create_visitor()[source]

Test creating a Visitor instance with valid data.

This test verifies that a Visitor instance can be created with valid data, including the necessary related instances such as Hall.

test_foreign_key_constraint()[source]

Test that Visitor cannot be created without a ForeignKey to Hall.

This test ensures that a Visitor instance cannot be created without a ForeignKey reference to a Hall instance.

test_optional_fields()[source]

Test that optional fields can be blank or null.

This test verifies that optional fields in the Visitor model, such as ‘name’ and ‘phone’, can be left blank or set to None.

Staff.urls module

Django URL Configuration Documentation

This module defines URL patterns for various views and static/media file serving during development.

Staff.urls.urlpatterns = [<URLPattern '' [name='staff']>, <URLPattern 'visitorToday/' [name='visitorToday']>, <URLPattern '^static/(?P<path>.*)$'>, <URLPattern '^media/(?P<path>.*)$'>]

URL Patterns:

  1. Staff View: - URL: / - View: views.staff - Name: ‘staff’ - Description: Renders the main staff view.

  2. Visitor Today View: - URL: /visitorToday/ - View: views.visitorToday - Name: ‘visitorToday’ - Description: Renders the view for visitors today.

Static and Media File Serving: - Static files (e.g., CSS, JavaScript) are served through the STATIC_URL and STATIC_ROOT settings. - Media files (e.g., uploaded user files) are served through the MEDIA_URL and MEDIA_ROOT settings.

Note: - During development, Django serves static and media files using these URL patterns. - In production, these URL patterns might be handled differently (e.g., by a web server or CDN).

Staff.views module

Staff.views.staff(request)[source]

View function for rendering the staff page.

If ‘visitor’ is in the POST request, redirects to ‘visitorToday’ page. Otherwise, renders the ‘staff.html’ template.

Parameters:

request – HTTP request object

Returns:

HTTP response object

Staff.views.visitorToday(request)[source]

View function for rendering the visitorToday page.

Retrieves today’s date and the staff member. Retrieves the list of visitors for today in the staff member’s hall. If ‘add’ is in the POST request, adds a new visitor record. If ‘departure’ is in the POST request, updates the departure time of the visitor. Renders the ‘visitorToday.html’ template with the context.

Parameters:

request – HTTP request object

Returns:

HTTP response object
